question: Shortest acting mydriatic and cycloplegic:
exp: Ans. D. TropicamideMydriatic action is useful for fundus examination and cycloplegic is useful for correct measurement of refractive error.Atropine is longest acting and tropicamide is shortest acting drug Anticholinergic drugs are contraindicated in Glaucoma.

question: Beta blockers are indicated for all of the following conditions except
exp: Ans. (A) Hypothyroidism(Ref: KDT 8th/e p164-165)Beta blockers are used to treat hyperthyroidism (not hypothyroidism).These are the only drugs that offer prophylactic benefits in a patient of varices who has never bled.
